result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J Puchinsky was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 4 day(s) RCJ for contempt for failure to pay.  $200 DNA surcharge assessed.
***Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law prior being released from jail.***

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel J Puchinsky

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per RASO - mandatory jail time has been served

Pre-trial conference at 10-01-2015 03:15 pm.
Status conference at 11-03-2015 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   No contact with the victim, BL (person, property, residence or family).    It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Daniel J Puchinsky in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Defendant Daniel J Puchinsky in custody.  Brian Van Schyndel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defense motions to dismiss the domestic abuse enhancer. 
State objects to motion to dismiss. 
BTC: Motion to dismiss is denied. Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 03:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mindy M. Nolan in court.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee. Defendant refuses to appear.  Initial appearance scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
